stories.text:
I tried recently to set up a FTP server on GCP (using vsftpd), and I couldn't get it work due to the server being behind a NAT and returning its internal IP address.

Considering that NAT are everywhere, is it still possible to run a FTP server these days without running constantly into that kind of issues? Or did NAT effectively kill FTP?
stories.title: Ask HN: Did Nat Kill FTP?
But Who Tells Them What to Sing? (2021)

stories.text:
I am very excited to announce that I've released a new RPC framework. I've been working on it for the past couple of minutes and it turned out great. It is built on top of the great work by Kelsey Hightower's nocode.

https://github.com/mostafa/noRPC #newproject
stories.title: A brand new RPC with ambitious promises
